sentences.sContent: She watched the parade from her perch on her father’s shoulders.
sentences.sCn: 她骑在父亲的肩上观看游行。

sentences.sContent: ...the vast slums that perch precariously on top of the hills around which the city was built.
sentences.sCn: …摇摇欲坠地坐落于城市中心群山之顶的大片贫民窟。

synos.tran: 栖息；就位；位于；使坐落于

words.tran: 栖于树上的鸟；高坐者；织物检查工

trans.tranOther: a branch or stick where a bird sits

trans.tranCn: 栖息；就位；位于；使坐落于
trans.tranOther: To perch somewhere means to be on the top or edge of something
